definition: to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: Tell that child to stop pouting.
sentences.chinese: 叫那孩子别撅着嘴撒娇。

sentences.chinese: 这，便是卖萌撒娇的时刻。

sentences.english: Of course , if the boy is very love belongs to act in pettish character .

sentences.english: It likes you quite a lot. It seems to want to be babied a little.

sentences.english: I could tell that she was probably a very affectionate and dependent woman.
sentences.chinese: 知道她可能是一位很会撒娇，很黏人的阿嬷。

sentences.english: Learn to be mischievous and coquetry.

sentences.english: See that the Huazhuanghe in typically covered with jackets to your coquetry .

sentences.chinese: 他们弹奏催眠的曲子安抚着卧室里撒娇的男孩。

sentences.english: The exertion that that wench acts in pettish is severe, I also ordinarily can not sustain the blows.
sentences.chinese: 那丫头撒娇的功夫是厉害，朕也经常招架不住的。

sentences.chinese: 不仅如此，面对单恋的教授，还会无辜撒娇。

sentences.english: Therefore , occasionally male , can let the woman pettish exert her mother's side .

sentences.english: Sammy loves to play and cuddle.

definition: to act cute/putting on adorable airs/to pretend to be lovely
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
lit. like a little bird relying on people (idiom)/fig. cute and helpless-looking
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
